verses.verse: And after He climbed on board into the boat, He crossed all the way over and went to His own city.

And look, they were bringing to Him a disabled man on a cot who had been bedridden. And when Jesus saw their trust, He said to the disabled man, "Be courageous, child. Your sins have been forgiven to you."
And look, some of the Old Testament transcribers said among themselves, "This Person is saying hurtful things."
And after Jesus saw their contemplations, He said, "Why do you contemplate evil things in your hearts?
You see, which is easier to say, 'The sins have been forgiven to you,' or to say 'Get up and traipse around?'

But so that you may realize that the Son of the Person has authority on the earth to be forgiving sins...." At that time, He says to the disabled man, "After getting up, pick up your cot, and go back to your house."
And after getting up, he went off to his house.
When the crowds saw it, they were amazed and admitted that God is magnificent, the One who gave this type of authority to the people.
And as Jesus passed by from there, He saw a person called Matthew sitting at the tax booth. And He says to him, "Follow Me." And after he stood up, he followed Him.
And it happened that He was reclining in the house. And look, when many tax collectors and sinful people came, they were reclining together with Jesus and His students.
And when the Separatists saw it, they said to His students, "Why is your Teacher eating with the tax collectors and sinful people?"
When Jesus heard it, He said to them, "The people who have strength have no need of a doctor, but the people who have it bad do.
After you travel off, learn what (Hosea 6:6) is, 'I want forgiving kindness and not sacrifice.' You see, I did not come to invite people who do what is right, but sinful people, to a change of ways."
At that time, the students of John came to Him, saying, "Why do we and the Separatists go without food often, but Your students do not go without food?"

And Jesus said to them, "The sons of the bride's room are not able to be grieving as long as the groom is with them, are they? But days will come when the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will go without food.
No one puts a patch of unprocessed cloth on a worn out robe. You see, what fills it in takes away from the robe, and the split becomes worse.

Neither do they put young wine into worn out leather bags. If they do, the leather bags definitely are ripped, the wine is spilled out, and the leather bags are ruined. But they put young wine into new leather bags, and both are preserved."

As He was speaking these things to them, look, when one head person came, he was bowing down to Him, saying, "My daughter passed away just now, but when You come, place Your hand on her, and she will live."
And when Jesus got up, He and His students followed him.
And look, when a woman who was bleeding for twelve years came up from behind, she touched the fringe of His robe.
You see, she was saying to herself, "If only I might touch His robe, I will be rescued."
When Jesus turned around and saw her, He said, "Daughter, be courageous, your trust has rescued you," and the woman was rescued from that hour.
And when Jesus came into the house of the head person and saw the flute players and the crowd being disruptive,
He says, "Get back. You see, the girl did not die, but she is sleeping." And they were laughing at Him.
After the crowd was thrown out, when He went in, He took hold of her hand, and the girl got up.
And the comments about her went out into all of that land.
And as Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed Him, yelling and saying, "Show forgiving kindness to us, son of David."
After He came into the house, the blind men came forward to Him, and Jesus says to them, "Do you trust that I am able to do this?" They say to Him, "Yes, Master."
Then He touched their eyes, saying, "It must happen to you according to your trust."
And their eyes were opened, and Jesus was stern with them, saying, "Look. No one must know."
After the blind men went out, they frequently commented about Him in all of that land.
As they were going out, look, they brought to Him a speech-impaired person who had a demon.
And when the demon was thrown out, the speech-impaired person spoke, and the crowds were amazed, saying, "Something like this never ever appeared in Israel."
But the Separatists were saying, "He throws the demons out by the head of the demons."

And Jesus led them around to all the cities and the villages teaching in their synagogues, speaking publicly about the good news of the empire, and healing every illness and every frailty among the ethnic group.
When He saw the crowds, He had sympathy concerning them because they were people who had given up and had been tossed as if they were sheep that don't have a shepherd.
At that time, He says to His students, "The harvest certainly is big, but the workers are few.
So plead with the master of the harvest in order that he might put workers out into his harvest."
